meanings.sent1: The cheetah outdistanced the tortoise in the race.
meanings.sent2: The airplane easily outdistanced the car on the long journey.
meanings.sent3: The snail tried to outdistanced the hare in the marathon, but it was a slow process.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outdistanced any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The river outdistanced the mountains, flowing far beyond their peaks.

meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or progress.
meanings.sent1: The sports car outdistanced all the other vehicles on the track.
meanings.sent2: The student's hard work outdistanced his classmates' efforts.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outdistanced the other animals in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: His innovative ideas outdistanced the competition in the market.
meanings.sent5: The rocket outdistanced all expectations, reaching the stars in record time.
